articles.headline: Emerging Markets Are Bouncing Back From a Six-Year Slowdown
articles.snippet: A faster-than-expected recovery in emerging markets, and the implications for global growth, are likely to be hot topics at the I.M.F. spring meetings.
articles.abstract: A faster-than-expected recovery in emerging markets, and the implications for global growth, are likely to be hot topics at the I.M.F. spring meetings.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Turkey hurtled toward one of the most politically divisive polls in its history, the country’s business leaders reacted in a curious manner.

articles.headline: It’s France’s Turn to Worry About Election Meddling by Russia
articles.snippet: Moscow and its state-run news outlets are churning out fake and slanted reports to bolster favored politicians, just as in the U.S. last year, critics say.
articles.abstract: Moscow and its state-run news outlets are churning out fake and slanted reports to bolster favored politicians, just as in the U.S. last year, critics say.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The flagging, scandal-plagued presidential campaign of François Fillon — a former prime minister of France much liked by the Kremlin but not so much, it seems, by French voters — received a surprise lift late last month with a report that he had staged a remarkable recovery in opinion polls and was now leading the pack ahead of voting this Sunday.

articles.headline: Trump’s Unreleased Taxes Threaten Yet Another Campaign Promise
articles.snippet: Democrats have pledged not to cooperate on an overhaul of the tax code unless they know how that rewrite would benefit the president and his family.
articles.abstract: Democrats have pledged not to cooperate on an overhaul of the tax code unless they know how that rewrite would benefit the president and his family.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s promise to enact a sweeping overhaul of the tax code is in serious jeopardy nearly 100 days into his tenure, and his refusal to release his own tax returns is emerging as a central hurdle to another faltering campaign promise.

articles.headline: Steve Ballmer Serves Up a Fascinating Data Trove
articles.snippet: A stealthy pet project by the former Microsoft chief lets you search and learn about how the government spends tax dollars.
articles.abstract: A stealthy pet project by the former Microsoft chief lets you search and learn about how the government spends tax dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: Guess what Steven A. Ballmer has been up to for the last several years. (No, not just cheering for the basketball team he owns, the Los Angeles Clippers.) It’s a novel project, and he plans to take the wrapping off it Tuesday.

articles.headline: A Murder Posted on Facebook Prompts Outrage and Questions Over Responsibility
articles.snippet: The social media network is struggling with its role in policing content on its global platform.
articles.abstract: The social media network is struggling with its role in policing content on its global platform.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On Easter, Steve Stephens drove around downtown Cleveland on what he said was a mission to commit murder — and soon he had an audience of millions for his shooting of Robert Godwin Sr., 74, which he recorded and posted on Facebook, the police in Cleveland said.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Christopher Mele

articles.headline: Theresa May Calls for New Election in Britain, Seeking Stronger ‘Brexit’ Mandate
articles.snippet: The prime minister had repeatedly ruled out a snap election but is now betting that her party can increase its majority.
articles.abstract: The prime minister had repeatedly ruled out a snap election but is now betting that her party can increase its majority.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain on Tuesday called for an early election in less than two months, clearly anxious that her thin majority in Parliament would weaken her hand in complicated negotiations on the British exit from the European Union.

articles.headline: Vijay Mallya, Once India’s ‘King of Good Times,’ Is Arrested in London
articles.snippet: He was held as part of extradition proceedings that could lead to him being sent back to India, which he fled over a year ago under an avalanche of unpaid bills and accusations of fraud.
articles.abstract: He was held as part of extradition proceedings that could lead to him being sent back to India, which he fled over a year ago under an avalanche of unpaid bills and accusations of fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Vijay Mallya has spent a lifetime building a reputation as India’s professed King of Good Times, a flamboyant tycoon with investments in alcohol, an airline and an auto racing team. But his freewheeling, free-spending ways ended last year when he fled India under an avalanche of unpaid bills and accusations of fraud.
articles.byline: By Amie Tsang and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: Already Unwelcoming, Hungary Now Detains Asylum Seekers
articles.snippet: New laws will keep migrants and refugees in vast camps surrounded by razor wire while their cases are decided. Even then, most will be rejected.
articles.abstract: New laws will keep migrants and refugees in vast camps surrounded by razor wire while their cases are decided. Even then, most will be rejected.
articles.lead_paragraph: HORGOS, Serbia — Double rows of razor-wire fences. High-tech watch towers equipped with search lights, motion sensors, cameras and loudspeakers. Hungary’s border with Serbia, specially fortified in the last two years to keep out migrants and refugees, is anything but a welcome mat.
